scene.name: intro
scene.line: You are in Bedquilt, a long east/west passage with holes everywhere.
*LULA* is here, panting for breath.
Did they follow us? Where's Joseph?

scene.name: wait-options
scene.option: I guess we could wait for an hour or so.
Keep waiting? She seems to want to wait. A month?
How long will it let us wait here? Like what's the maximum time?

scene.name: scared
scene.line: `(Typing.)` ~Reassure Lula.~
I know, but ... never mind. I don't want to think about it.
We should ... I guess we should wait for Joseph here. This is where he'll go, right?

scene.name: wait-first
scene.line: `(Typing.)` ~Wait.~
Time passes. Lula nervously runs her hand along a vein in the cave wall.

scene.name: wait-hour
scene.line: `(Typing.)` ~Wait for an hour.~
Time passes. A shifting, fluttering sound grows louder from one of the tunnels.
What's that? Joseph?
Five disoriented bats stumble through your lantern light and off into an adjacent passage.

scene.name: wait-day
scene.line: `(Typing.)` ~Wait for a day.~
Time passes.
Hey, I found some water running clear down this tunnel here. I think we're OK on food for now ... if you don't mind subsisting on jerky. Joseph packed a lot of jerky.
I'll try to start a fire, I guess. I don't know.

scene.name: wait-month
scene.line: `(Typing.)` ~Wait for a month.~
Time passes.
You begin to measure days and nights by the life and death of the fire.
Do you know how these caves and tunnels got here? Erosion. You apply a process long enough, and eventually a new place results. I'd like to make my own places, I think. My own caves ...
Lula withdraws into her sketchbook for several days, or maybe longer.

scene.name: wait-year
scene.line: `(Typing.)` ~Wait indefinitely.~
Time passes.
*JOSEPH* is here. He's either just arrived, or has been standing here for some period of time.

scene.name: search
scene.line: `(Typing.)` ~Search.~
I only understood you as far as wanting to search.
We have to be more specific ...

scene.name: search-tunnel
scene.line: `(Typing.)` ~Search tunnel.~
You select a tunnel at random. Your lantern illuminates several sets of footprints on the moldy cave floor, but they are impossible to identify.

scene.name: search-equipment
scene.line: `(Typing.)` ~Search equipment.~
The various computer and audio equipment casts angular shadows into the tunnels as you scan slowly across the pile. Nothing.

scene.name: search-outside
scene.line: `(Typing.)` ~Search outside.~

You grab hold of the rope and slowly climb up. Your days lecturing on esoteric computer science topics did not prepare you to scale cave walls with rope. Your evenings gathering with friends to roll dice and consult fancifully illustrated charts, however, prepared you for the likelihood that this climb could end badly.
You carefully descend back into the cave.

scene.name: search-found-joseph
scene.line: *JOSEPH* climbs down from the rope still tied above.
*JOSEPH* steps cautiously out from behind the computer equipment.
*JOSEPH* emerges suddenly from one of the tunnels.

scene.name: found-joseph
scene.line: That damn sound! Those damn voices! I don't even know what direction I was running. I wove through that network of tunnels. I ran my hand along the wall, always turning left, but every turn and every rock felt the same. For all I knew, I was running in circles!
Finally, I ended up here.
And I hid ... I panicked. I heard you talking, but ... I didn't think I could trust my senses.
I heard you talking, but ... I didn't think I could trust my senses.
I guess must have fallen asleep. I heard you talking, but I thought I was dreaming.

Eventually, I must have fallen asleep. I heard you talking, but I didn't know what to trust. I ran away again, back into the tunnels, for ... I don't know how long. There's plenty of fresh water trickling through these caves. I kept alive with that and cave plants. I learned to enjoy the taste of bat. What an ugly appetite.

When I heard you coming, I ran. I could only hear the echoes of your voices at first, and ... I didn't know what to trust! In the tunnels, I found a mess of strange things. Some of it I don't want to talk about, some of it I don't know how ... and on some of it I was sworn to secrecy!
But, listen: there's one thing I have to tell you. While I was out there lost in the tunnels and caves, I came across the |Zero|, and ... I had no idea.
It's like a real place: they pick up garbage, they deliver mail, they go to work and to church ... but it has an awful kind of emptiness.
Wandering through, I heard horrible echoes. Weird images got burned in my mind's eye:
A television, a scarecrow, a crystal, a feather, a sandwich ... a CRT monitor, a bottle ... an anchor ...
*LULA* looks down at her feet.
scene.option: We should ask him more about that.

scene.name: intro-zero-lula
scene.line: `(Typing.)` ~Ask Lula what is up.~
Nothing.
Just ... Joseph, you sound ... disturbed.
Lula, you've heard the same damned stories I have â€”

scene.name: intro-zero-direct
scene.line: `(Typing.)` ~Ask Joseph about the ~|Zero|~.~
Donald, you've heard the same damned stories I have, but ... it's different!

scene.name: fight
scene.line: It doesn't matter now, dammit. I'm leaving. To hell with all of it!
scene.option: Get him back on track, we're so close.

scene.name: fight-2-stop
scene.line: `(Typing.)` ~Stop Joseph.~

scene.name: fight-2-back-on-track
scene.line: `(Typing.)` ~Divert Joseph's attention.~

scene.name: fight-2
scene.line: You shout something at *JOSEPH* about the project you are working on together.
You'll die in these damn cold caves! And what about those men? You know they'll come back.
scene.option: Tell him we can find somewhere to start a fire.
Tell him we can hide from the strangers.

scene.name: fight-3-fire
scene.line: `(Typing.)` ~Suggest finding somewhere safe to start a fire.~

scene.name: fight-3-hide
scene.line: `(Typing.)` ~Suggest finding a hiding place.~

scene.name: fight-3
scene.line: You shout something at *JOSEPH* about going deeper into the caves.
Did you hear their voices? They're not ... they'll find you. But not me. I'm going back to the surface.

Stop! Your stupid fight is ringing through the whole damned cave. Joseph is right: we can't stay here. I'm leaving, too. But I'm not going back to the surface. I'm taking my station wagon and I'm heading down the |Zero|.
scene.option: I think we need her to stay.
Whoa, don't let her leave us here.

scene.name: fight-4-stay
scene.line: `(Typing.)` ~Ask Lula to stay.~

scene.name: fight-4-follow
scene.line: `(Typing.)` ~Get Lula's attention.~

scene.name: fight-4
scene.line: You plead with *LULA* about your continued collaboration.
I'll send you this tape when I'm done recording. I'll put it in the mail. And then you can see what your damned machine does with it.
*LULA* and *JOSEPH* have left.
